ratingSummary.consensus: X-Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series to produce a satisfyingly fast-paced outing that ranks among the franchise's finest installments.

title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
advisory: for sequences of intense sci-fi violence and action, some suggestive material, nudity and language
synopsis: The ultimate X-Men ensemble fights a war for the survival of the species across two time periods in X-MEN: DAYS OF FUTURE PAST. The beloved characters from the original "X-Men" film trilogy join forces with their younger selves from the past, "X-Men: First Class," in order to change a major historical event and fight in an epic battle that could save our future. (c) Fox

reviews.quote: It is especially impressive that Days of Future Past is a success; a film this gooey and complex, with such business-minded scope, should not feel like a real movie at all.

With grand returns of beloved stars and fan-favorite characters supported by the growth and integration of new blood, the result is one of the most extraordinary and remarkable film franchise rescues ever thought possible.
The only things larger than the movie's lengthy list of stars are the big ideas contained within.
The bland antagonists merely pose the threat that requires tampering with the past, allowing the majority of the adventure to focus on the more standout heroes.
With its time-twisting plot, sci-fi soapiness, powerful humanism, and to-die-for cast, this is the summer blockbuster done with elegance and heart.
It acts as a jumpstart to a series that needed fresh legs to stand on.
X-Men: Days of Future Past is a rollercoaster of an epic film and towards the end (without realising it), I started becoming emotional.
Epic and wide reaching, Days of Future Past is a solid follow up to First Class, but a number flaws keep it from being one of the best of the franchise.
X-Men: Days of Future Past is another great entry in a series that has had its highs and lows.
Sometimes it's gloomy, but most of the time the humorous moments, the wide cast and the action sequences make X-Men: Days of Future Past devilishly entertaining. [Full review in Spanish]

Despite being plagued by some familiar problems in Bryan Singer's X-Men movies, this thrilling time-travelling adventure combines the casts of two eras of the franchise for possibly the best instalment yet.
One of the stronger comic book films to emerge from Marvel.
